website_summaries.verdict: An inexpensive laser with impressive distance and accuracy in unit with handy features.
pros: Offers an impressive distance of 196 feet for an affordable price
Delivers accuracy to 1/16 of an inch and has 2 bubbles
Powered by 2 AAA batteries which come with it
Easy to use, and capable of storing up to 30 date groupings
cons: Owners have griped about the display being difficult to read in bright outdoor light
Fraction readings are small and hard to see

customer_reviews.title: EASY TO USE AND VERY ACCURATE
customer_reviews.text: We use Bosch and Dewalt lasers but needed an extra as the office was always fighting over them. Both previously mentioned lasers work great but cost considerably more. I decided to take a chance on the Tacklife since it was only to be used as an extra but was very pleasantly surprised by its quality and accuracy. It's easy to use and works perfectly at a very attractive price when compared to its competition. The only reason I elected to give 4 stars instead of 5 is because the numbers are a bit small compared to others. Luckily my vision is still good but I imagine it could be hard to read otherwise.
customer_reviews.author: JAY ARRE

customer_reviews.title: A Great Gift!
customer_reviews.text: A gift for my Engineer son, we immediately set about to determine the accuracy of this device, using a metal yardstick to gauge distance to a wall. The results were within 1/16 of an inch, and that was to textured wallboard. The texture varied that much! This thing is accurate. The zero baseline can be adjusted to coincide with the top OR bottom surface, allowing for inside and outside measurements. Displayed units can be changed from metric to the actually useful units of feet, inches, and fractions of inches. Their new puppy loved to chase the laser, so be careful around animals.
customer_reviews.author: G. Possert

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't work in sunshine
customer_reviews.text: This unit works good inside - very impressive, but doesn't work good at all outside during daylight hours. At night it works "pretty good" as long as you've got a very solid reflective surface. Nothing like as good as a typical rangefinder. If you wish to take outside measurements, don't get this unit, get a true rangefinder. For inside work I'd give it a 5 star, for outside work a 1 star, so the 3 star is an average of the two. I'll keep the unit just for inside measurements and not have the hassle of returning.
customer_reviews.author: KenH

customer_reviews.title: OK for the price
customer_reviews.text: Instructions are in pseudo-English, so maybe I'm doing something wrong, but it's off by 1/8" in a 5' measurement, which is unacceptable. Self-calibration procedure doesn't work as described, so I can't calibrate it. Update: I bought a similar product ( to see how they compared, suspecting (correctly, as it turned out) that they were identical internally. But between the two of them, I was able to decode the instructions and calibrate them both (they were both off by the identical amount). But the Morpilot version came with a target plate and a pair of red glasses, and was a couple bucks cheaper, so is (IMHO) a better buy.
customer_reviews.author: M. Fred

customer_reviews.title: No More Tape Measures and Second Person Needed!
customer_reviews.text: The Tacklife HD60 works like a charm and is perfectly accurate. It is an affordable tool that eliminates having to find a second person to hold the far end of the tape. All you need is something at the other end for the laser to get a reflective 'fix' on, and you're good to go. You can use either end of the Tacklife as the zero reference point, which makes it nice for all different applications. A very handy and useful addition to your toolbox.
customer_reviews.author: Grandma Moose

customer_reviews.title: Fine for Estimates, Not Precision
customer_reviews.text: I am a trim carpenter and have recently been trying some laser measurers to see if I could find one accurate enough to leave the tape measure in the tool box. First the good: it comes with a case. This laser is not consistent enough to make accurate cuts every time. 3 times measuring the same length could result in 3 different measurements. It was off by more than 1/8th inch even on something less than a couple feet. This laser would be fine for estimates but not precision work.
customer_reviews.author: E Adgate

customer_reviews.title: Limited Capability
customer_reviews.text: It cannot measure large distances (>30 ft) outside. So, if you wanted to measure lot lines, with respect to the structure, do not buy this item.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not Happy
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this product and a 2 year warranty. The laser does not work in sunlight, nor does it measure as far as it says on the advertisement. I am trying to utilize my warranty, but I have had no luck.
customer_reviews.author: Regina Arriaga

customer_reviews.title: This is a very good tool and nicely made
customer_reviews.text: This is a very good tool and nicely made. My only problem with it, which is a deal killer, is that the display for fractions are so small that I cannot confidently know what is is. 1/16th and 7/16th look the same even with my reading glasses on. Fraction #'s need to be larger.
customer_reviews.author: Dana Andrews

customer_reviews.title: must have
customer_reviews.text: this thing is dead on. I have hit almost 160' easily with this thing and it maybe only off by an 1" at that range. closer readings, its dead on. the red dot is huge and super easy to see in broad daylight actually. I have hit trees, curbs, signs, metal siding, and even office cubicles with out any problems yet. super easy to use and way better than the bosch the company uses and my old craftsman that struggled to hit anything within 100'. and its cheap too
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very expensive inoperative toy that doesn't measure properly.
customer_reviews.text: I'm a real estate agent and have to measure homes when I'm putting them on the market I needed one of these to make my job easier. This does not make your job easier because half the time it doesn't work and when it does work it doesn't measure properly. The first couple times I used it I went back and double checked with my actual tape measure and the laser measure was off by a couple of feet in every single instance. Please don't waste your time this is an expensive toy that doesn't work I'm out money that I can't get back now.
customer_reviews.author: Crazy MommyCally

customer_reviews.title: Inaccurate - by a lot!
customer_reviews.text: I used this to layout a wooden floor and was getting goofy measurements....I used my other one a bosch......and the tacklife was off by inches....I cannot be off by inches. Also, the backlight does not stay on very long. Sorry..
customer_reviews.author: phototgguy

customer_reviews.title: Great Laser Measure: Why did I wait so long to get one of these
customer_reviews.text: This little device was a great purchase. Everything works as advertised and it's truly accurate to 1/16" over long distances! The automatic area feature is great and saves a ton of time. My biggest regret is not getting one of these sooner. The price can't be beat for the features and accuracy this packs at any local box store. The only con that I've found is that it's a bit tricky to change some modes. You have to turn it off, then back on again to switch certain things. Once you're aware of that, it's very simple to operate.
customer_reviews.author: Nylox

customer_reviews.title: Way Better than Tape Measure!
customer_reviews.text: I got this because I am going to be doing some floor covering replacement soon, and wanted a reliable way to measure rooms by myself. I've also taken it to work to measure office space when I am moved, so I can plan how the furniture will be set up. Love the range, the ability to switch between meters and feet, and auto calculation of square footage. The pets like the laser dot that is used for aiming. Very happy with this!
customer_reviews.author: S

customer_reviews.title: Simple Interior Measurement Device
customer_reviews.text: This is a lightweight solution for measuring interior spaces. I use it for estimating materials and construction of interior spaces. It was accurate to within 1/2". Not for measurements used to cut materials but good for estimating and for creating as-built drawings.
customer_reviews.author: Van Webster

customer_reviews.title: For the dollar, it's pretty dang accurate
customer_reviews.text: I love this tool - have never used a laser measure before, and was a bit skeptical, but it really helps speed projects up. I built some carriage doors for my garage and had no issues with accuracy. It claims to be accurate to 1/16" and for most of the measuring I did (I was working with various distances of 13 feet and under), it definitely met that claim. With very short distances (like, under 8"), it seems to get a little confused, but you likely will be using a tape measure anyway for short stuff. Overall, very happy with this tool!
customer_reviews.author: Dug

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use, fractional inches difficult to read
customer_reviews.text: The operation was simple. I changed the setting so it would read in feet and inches. I checked a few measurements on my kitchen using it vs what I had measured with a tape measurement and they agreed fairly well. It is difficult to know which is more accurate since a tape measurement is prone to sagging for long measurements. I am older and reading the fractional inches, like 1/16 or 7/16 was difficult for me. I had to use a magnifying glass to tell the difference. They manual is also not designed for people with visual challenges. I may try some of the other readout choices. The cats really liked the visible dot.
customer_reviews.author: Stepinwolf

customer_reviews.title: Was easy to use and would recommend to anyone that is ...
customer_reviews.text: This is a vital new tool in my tool box. I work in a warehouse and had to do some measuring and layouts for several systems upgrades. This made life easier than using a small tape measure to get the dimensions and layout of the warehouse floor. Was easy to use and would recommend to anyone that is looking to purchase a laser measuring device. I liked the nearly 200 ft distance, clear and easy to read display, and compact size.
customer_reviews.author: John Gilbert

customer_reviews.title: No where to get relief on warranty—and AMAZON does not intercede???
customer_reviews.text: The HD60 in April- I have used it twice. I went to measure the dining room and the Lazer light is on but appears to be broken inside. I cannot find out from either Amazon or Tacklife what to do about it-apparently there is a warranty in place but obviously does not mean much.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: So far, impressed.
customer_reviews.text: So far this has been very accurate. I have tried it 4 times at the same distance and then used my tape measure to double check the measurement, all came out exactly the same. That is better than my more expensive name brands and it measures greater distances.
customer_reviews.author: Robert R

customer_reviews.title: Accurate,  can display fractions of inches
customer_reviews.text: Very handy, will display fractions such as 1/8, 3/32, etc., which is so much easier for those of us that live in the USA. Yes, the metric system would be so much easier, but that isn't going to happen in my lifetime. This device will agree with the scale on your tape measure, table saw, etc, and make measuring and cutting much easier than converting from decimals, like some laser measures require. Battery life seems good so far, I'm still on the same set.
customer_reviews.author: Grandpa

customer_reviews.title: Great product! Great features!
customer_reviews.text: I'm an industrial/commercial real estate agent and I love this model. Very helpful! Easy to operate and read as well a being accurate. Love the ability to change units for some clients want feet while others want/need yards. Love the area/perimeter addition feature as well as the ability to measure using Pythagorean theorem. (*note that most newer models and brands will do the same thing but still needs to be mentioned) I really appreciate the belt pouch that comes with it. My colleague has more of a case style for his which is bulky so he never uses it. But the pouch is perfect and keeps mine safe and accessible while walking properties. Definitely recommend this unit.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen

customer_reviews.title: Poor
customer_reviews.text: I only used it a couple of times, now its showing different measurements every time i use it on same measure. Poor quality
customer_reviews.author: satish

customer_reviews.title: Great device
customer_reviews.text: This is my first laser measure, and it seems like a great value. I confirm a measurement once each day I use it and it's been accurate every time so far. It's pretty easy to use after you set it up - set up is also easy due to the well written English instructions. I use this laser measure on set for photo shoots. Distances between product, light, and camera need to be documented and it is much easier to do that with a laser than a tape.
customer_reviews.author: Jason!

customer_reviews.title: really good in terms of one-man measuring vs a tape
customer_reviews.text: first laser measuring, been loving it. really good in terms of one-man measuring vs a tape. seems very accurate. the levels have been semi useful but they could be larger. i find myself getting my big one out normally. these small ones are hard to read from more than a few feet away.
customer_reviews.author: Michael McDonald

customer_reviews.title: Seems very accurate.  Well priced.  Pretty easy to use
customer_reviews.text: It does what it says. You need to read the manual as it has a lot of options. TIP: the unit knows how long it is, so you need to plant the the based at the starting point and then measure dont measure from the front where the laser is
customer_reviews.author: Boca Techie

customer_reviews.title: This is legit.
customer_reviews.text: Honestly this thing seems it should cost a lot more. True story. I work as an electrician and it helps me calculate lengths that i need to add up really fast. You DO need to read the manual to understand how it works especially the adding subtracting fx. The pouch it comes with is a little too tight. Makes it a two hand operation to put it back in. Otherwise 5/5.
customer_reviews.author: Ivan Medeiros

customer_reviews.title: LOVE this thing
customer_reviews.text: As a realtor, I've had bad experieince with a lot of similar items. This being laser-based instead of sound wave-based gave me pause but I went ahead and ordered it and i freaking love this thing. It is accurate, it works quick, and it has a variety of options to customize it for your needs that day.
customer_reviews.author: Richard Allen

customer_reviews.title: Tape Measures are a Thing of the Past
customer_reviews.text: This tool is amazing - and very accurate. Instructions are easy to follow. Since we are getting our home renovated with new floor tiles, I measured the square-footage with a tape measure. Uncertain of my results, I used this tool to "verify" my measurements. Not only was it more accurate (verified my figures but was more accurate), but it was faster. It has many more functions than I will probably need/use, but it's a comfort knowing they are available should I need them. I will remember to remove the batteries when not used for long periods.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas Dawson III

customer_reviews.title: Gamechanger
customer_reviews.text: For most tasks I typically use a Fatmax 30' (which in reality gets you about 27'), but there are many times when this little gizmo makes life so much better--quicker, easier, and more accurate. You can't beat it for hanging trim, laying carpet, or framing between existing members. It's dead accurate (to 1/16") and easy to use, except that the readout is a wee bit small for my ageing eyes. So much better than bending metal tape into a corner. If you're any kind of building pro, this is essential and effective and an excellent value.
customer_reviews.author: zverina dot com

customer_reviews.title: Super useful
customer_reviews.text: Love it. It’s such a cool little toy. I wish I discovered it earlier. I’m just a home owner but I like to get something done myself, every so often get that itch :) this is super easy and super accurate. I think it’s an awesome value for the money.
customer_reviews.author: SM

customer_reviews.title: Just as good as Bosch for half the money
customer_reviews.text: I own a fire & water restoration business and own several Bosch laser tape measures and have always been happy with them. Recently when I needed to buy another one I noticed some much less expensive off brand units on Amazon that seemed to have good reviews. I decided to try this Tacklife model to see if it might be a cost effective substitute. So far I'm pleased. It is accurate, easy to use and the build quality appears durable. I'll update this review later if I have any trouble with it.
customer_reviews.author: SteveD

customer_reviews.title: Simply awesome
customer_reviews.text: I do work around the house alone. This laser measure makes it so easy to take any measurement without the hassle of the tape twisting, or the tip not catching, or moving the ladder to reach a spot.... It does exactly what it is supposed to do, well worth the money! I cannot comment on longevity yet, I had it for a few weeks only.
customer_reviews.author: Dude

customer_reviews.title: Great little tool
customer_reviews.text: Makes my life simpler as a realtor checking houses. Fast and more than accurate enough. Love the features built in.
customer_reviews.author: BigDawgRR

customer_reviews.title: I like gadgets
customer_reviews.text: OK, so this is cool. The instruction will require a MICROSCOPE to read. Very accurate. However when using outside and holding, hard to find the laser. One has to play with this for a few hours to get how it works. If using outside, use a clipboard and white printer paper taped down. The little card is almost impossible to find unless you have a tripod and this doesn't have a tripod mount hole. VERY ACCURATE.
customer_reviews.author: L. Truitt

customer_reviews.title: Great while it lasted, which was not that long
customer_reviews.text: I bought two laser measures to compare and decided that this one was worth the extra cost after a few uses. Unfortunately, after 3 months of no use (no batteries that leaked, just stored in a drawer), it doesn't work anymore! The screen shows flickers of random lines instead of readable letters and numbers, and it only does that for a couple of seconds before dying. Tried different batteries, checked the instructions. Useless, and not only a waste of money, it failed me at a critical moment when I had one shot to measure an apartment, and I couldn't confirm something very important about the dimensions.
customer_reviews.author: Ingmar Ludwig

customer_reviews.title: Inconsistent
customer_reviews.text: Tested this next to a different laser and it was off by 5ft or more depending.
customer_reviews.author: Brittany Sorgenfrie

customer_reviews.title: Very handy. Makes my work faster and efficient
customer_reviews.text: Well I sell floors so I have to measure homes frequently. I get a lot of crotchety old men who love to argument and the accuracy of my handy dandy laser. So when he whips his out, measuring tape that is, and I use my laser, I show them who’s boss so I can finish my job. My fat fingered at times so hit other buttons so I have to spend extra time fiddle farting around trying to get it back to feet and inches. Thanks a lot burger and fries..
customer_reviews.author: Katy Garcia

customer_reviews.title: Great, durable product for the price.
customer_reviews.text: This was the first product of its kind that I've purchased. I needed something for work that worked well without breaking the bank. So I've had this product about 6 months now and while I don't use it that often, it works perfectly for whatever I need, from making measurements in large buildings, or in small spaces for laying tile in bathrooms. It has a ton of options and there's a learning curve, but it's easy to use once you've used it a bit.
customer_reviews.author: Yugzster

customer_reviews.title: Perfect laser measuring device for my needs
customer_reviews.text: Arrived extremely fast and exactly as advertised. Setup and use couldn't be more simple. I glanced through the included manual just to fully understand the different operations. I only plan to use it for simple distance measurements, but it's fully capable of adding multiple distances and calculating area/volume of squares/cubes and even triangles. Comes with a compact carry case and lanyard. Really couldn't ask for more in a laser measurement device.
customer_reviews.author: Brian B

customer_reviews.title: I’ve got a PhD in measurement taking now!!
customer_reviews.text: Cool little gadget! I think I spent almost 2 hours measuring the same room 25 different ways. Not because I couldn’t figure out how to use the thing, but because there are so many cool functions and I wanted to double check everything with a manual tape measure! Lol Long story short... extremely accurate and easy to use! Add it to your tool collection. You won’t regret it!
customer_reviews.author: M. Silverio

customer_reviews.title: Very good build - Imperial fraction is for genius -
customer_reviews.text: Very neat tool. Got to have a stable hand, but the measurements are fast and fairly accurate. Imperial fractions are tiny - like font size of 5. so it will read 10' 05" 1/16". Decimals are so much easier to work with. Why does United States have to hold onto imperial and time change, spring forward and fall backward? I guess this is why I struggled with math concepts. It was imperial math and sleep apnea. Aside from my pet peeves, this Hacklife is very good for the money spent.
customer_reviews.author: paul

customer_reviews.title: Great so far!
customer_reviews.text: Item showed up quickly, and received the product as advertised. Came with a case, lanyard, and a convenient reflection card to help with measurements. Have used this about a dozen times for outdoor approximations (50'-150' or so). The square footage and volume calculations are nifty. I still carry a tape measure, and a big reel tape, but sometimes you can't get all the way to the item you're measuring to/from. Great value so far.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Malfunctioned almost immediately
customer_reviews.text: I bought this last Spring on a daily deal but didn’t get around to using it today. I made about a dozen measurements and then it started malfunctioning. The Units/Reference switch apparently stuck. It won’t let you turn off the unit without removing the batteries and it Intermittently flashes back and forth on the reference point when measuring & changes the unit of measure on it’s own but won’t let you change them.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: This is an awesome tool!
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use, read the instructions first so you understand the modes. Highly accurate! Measured my whole house for new carpet in less than 10 minutes!!!
customer_reviews.author: Jason

customer_reviews.title: Great functionality for the price
customer_reviews.text: Great functionality for the price. You see comparable units selling in Home Depot for over a hundred dollars. I really like the variety of units it can use to display and the area calculations it can perform. You can also set it to measure from the top or bottom of the device. Very versatile and a great value.
customer_reviews.author: R. Nelson

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use and accurate
customer_reviews.text: This tool makes measuring so much easier. At first I wasn't sure how accurate these type of measuring tools were. The first few measurements I took with this I had to double check with a tape measure. Measuring with this is very accurate. Having a level and being able to measure distance, volume, and area is a huge plus. These extra features over some of the other types is what makes this one stand out.
customer_reviews.author: JGonzales

customer_reviews.title: Innacurate
customer_reviews.text: Innacurate. Not even consistently innacurate so that you can judge off of that. Seems well built but it doesn't really matter how well it's built if it can't do the job it's made for
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works well except long distance in bright sunlight
customer_reviews.text: I used this several times indoors and outdoors in subdued light. When I tried to measure my driveway (about 200') in bright sunlight, it would not give a reading. I don't know if that was because the sun interfered with the operation of the unit or because I could not see the aiming light. It worked fine at that distance in the evening.
customer_reviews.author: Hugh Curley

customer_reviews.title: Accurate. Lots of settings. Keeps memory of units.
customer_reviews.text: So far I am blown away with the accuracy and number of settings. For the price I couldn't be happier. It was this or a Bosch. I'm glad I got this one for half the price. It remembers the last units you used after turning off and on. Displays fractions to the nearest 1/16 or decimal. Would recommend to a friend.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel S.

customer_reviews.title: Just as good as my bosch
customer_reviews.text: Just as good as my bosch, lica and dewalt for 1/4 the cost. But like all the others the numbers are too small--fractions are tiny. Bosch is useless because it measures to 32nds--quick, what's 27/32nds? Ironically they're all only accurate to 1/8th. Obviously someone in metric land thought this was a good thing. Tacklife is all anyone needs. I measure things professionally. I bought this as a second model to check on my Dewalt that's been dropped too many times. They're both the same, with any luck that means they're both accurate.
customer_reviews.author: zowie

customer_reviews.title: Really liking it
customer_reviews.text: I work in IT, and keep a lot of not so common tools in my bag since I'm regularly asked to do little things where they might work. I picked this up on a whim. I've used it a lot since it arrived and it's been a blessing. Being able to grab a few measurements at once to compare things is helpful, and measuring a full area that way is just great. I round a lot since the accuracy is in the range of "is it at the slightest angle? Cool. 15/16th of an inch." That's my only real complaint.
customer_reviews.author: JP Powers

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: Small, easy to read and for the most part easy to use. It would probably help if I sat down and read the instructions so I know how to change between INCHES, FEET and METERS ... LoL!! It has lots of functions that I probably won't use, but that is me. I have been using it for about a week and I have zero complaints.
customer_reviews.author: T. Hank

customer_reviews.title: Best purchase in years!
customer_reviews.text: I recently purchased this unit for measuring homes for real estate. Prior to this, for 18 years, I have used a cheaper measuring device that did not, of course, have the laser beam. This unit is SO much more accurate and I love it. Although there was nothing wrong with me other device, I am very glad I purchased this.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Claessens

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely love this thing!
customer_reviews.text: Decided to be this inexpensive unit as an experiment. If it went well, I'd maybe buy a higher-end Bosch or similar. That was almost two years ago. I still love this thing. It's incredibly accurate and easy to use. I decided to not upgrade. In fact, if this one ever dies, I'm just going to buy another one.
customer_reviews.author: Fred Lackey

customer_reviews.title: Has great range, but not during daylight outside
customer_reviews.text: Works OK. Has many settings that allow different ways to display the lengths especially portions of a foot (decimals, fractions, inches, etc.). I was using it to measure my property lines and couldn't get a 35 foot distance until it was almost night time (late dusk). During daylight the maximum was about 17 feet.
customer_reviews.author: Edward B. Diederich

customer_reviews.title: Use it much more often than the old measuring tape.
customer_reviews.text: Significantly exceeded my expectations! Since I got it use it much more often than the old measuring tape. It is very handy, that it knows geometry and can get the distance, that cannot be accessed usual way, like tree or house height, etc. Extremely convenient to get a quick measurement and its precision is more than enough for my needs.
customer_reviews.author: DSh

customer_reviews.title: Does more for a lot less than the big box brands
customer_reviews.text: I was a little uncertain that this was accurate, so, tested it a number of times on areas 15' and under (common sizes I use) and it was surprisingly accurate! I've already recommended this to a number of people. Great little tool for a lot less than the name brand stuff you'll find at Home Depot or Lowe's. And, it does more than the higher priced comparable products at those stores. Would buy again in a heartbeat.
customer_reviews.author: DG

customer_reviews.title: Solid product for everyday heavy use.
customer_reviews.text: I'm a Real Estate appraiser and measure houses every day. I bought this to replace my old Presiso Laser. After a couple of months use I find the batteries last longer than my old laser and it is very fast and reliable. Nice small size and a great Price.
customer_reviews.author: Bruce Flanagan Jr.

customer_reviews.title: A great tool that functions well for the price
customer_reviews.text: I was pleasantly surprised but the quality of this laser measure. I almost picked one up at Home Depot for triple the cost, but decided to take a chance on this one instead. I've been using it for the past month to measure spaces for our new house, and I've been really impressed by it. I recommend it without any reservations, and I'd probably pick up other tools by Tacklife in the future because this one works so well.
customer_reviews.author: NimueBookworm

customer_reviews.title: measured the highest limb on my trees
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to measure the distance from my house to the corner of my barn (150ft). found some other uses to. I shined the lazer to the highest limb I could see on one of my pine trees and got a reading . cool. this device will also calculate cubic feet and square feet in a room and adds it up for you . love it
customer_reviews.author: CHad

customer_reviews.title: Requires a button press to capture the measurement.
customer_reviews.text: This product has worked well, but I previously had a Bosch (died from a corrosive battery), and once turned on, you could point the laser and it would immediately spit out measurements. This product you have to line up, then click the button to get the reading. It's a minor annoyance when you have to get a lot of measurements. With the Bosch, you could move the laser from place to place and just look at the screen to see the reading. Clicking the button would "save" the info and immediately start spitting out measurements again on a new line.
customer_reviews.author: PenThief

customer_reviews.title: Great Laser Measure!
customer_reviews.text: This measure is easy to use! I use it for my Real Estate Business!
customer_reviews.author: Notorious RPG

customer_reviews.title: More accurate than a"Smart Alek" on the other end of a tape.
customer_reviews.text: I'm 72, halt, lame, almost deaf, half blind and cranky! If I can make this great tool work, almost anyone WHO READS THE DIRECTIONS can make it work well also. As for accuracy:: It's more accurate than trusting a "Smart Alek" on the other end of a tape measure 🤨.
customer_reviews.author: Don T

customer_reviews.title: East to use and accurate
customer_reviews.text: Found the Tacklife HD60 easy to use and tested and found to be very accurate. Especially like the feature that allows calculation of square footage.
customer_reviews.author: PAC

customer_reviews.title: Kinda fun and cool :-)
customer_reviews.text: I really like having this in my tool selection. My home has really high ceilings in some places and as i work on my house its a terrific option to not have to necessarily drag out ladders or move things out of the way just to get a general length and width number. If i was a perfectionist, maybe I would work differently with this device but its fine for me in the way I use it now. I measure two or three times just to make sure i'm using it correctly. As time goes by i'm sure i will feel good about just measuring twice. :-)
customer_reviews.author: jpegsam

customer_reviews.title: Really cool
customer_reviews.text: Not at all what i thought i was buying...lol...but when my boyfriend got it and opened it he immediately realized this wasnt what either ofnus thought it was....he quickly learned what it was and thought it way cooler then what we thought it was. He and i had no idea you could have a tool to give such accurate measurements on a bedroom or space...i love it!
customer_reviews.author: Jessie

customer_reviews.title: Small tool packs a punch for easy measuring
customer_reviews.text: I saw someone use this tool and I immediately wanted one. We are remodeling our kitchen and I wanted to figure out the measurements easily for designing purposes. Easy to switch between inches, feet, etc. I also used this recently to measure a board for a woodworking project.
customer_reviews.author: Cyndi

customer_reviews.title: Not good as an outdoor tool
customer_reviews.text: Does not work in bright sunlight at distances over 25'. Target was a 2' x 3' white plastic sheet. Worked at less than 25 feet, but no further. Have not tried it in night conditions. Too many fields on display for simple point and shoot measurement. Calibration instructions are absolutely useless.
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: Increases production time
customer_reviews.text: This is a great tool for taking building measurements. As an architect I constantly have to measure existing buildings before producing plans and there are always objects in the way, this allows me to position the laser away from the obstacles and get a clean measurement.
customer_reviews.author: Cobra 2

customer_reviews.title: It works as advertised and is far more cost efficient than the other major brands.
customer_reviews.text: Works great and the accompanying instructions helps a lot. This is my first time to use this and while I only use it occasionally, watching YouTube videos made it easier for me. Be mindful though when changing the unit of measure as you might inadvertently change the reference starting point (front of the device or from the tail of the device).
customer_reviews.author: Raffy C.

customer_reviews.title: LCD is erratic and missing characters. Very disappointing...
customer_reviews.text: I only used this a couple of times while installing hardwood floors. This laser tape measure was sitting in my tool box for a while. I went to use it to lay out some garage lights and the display is missing characters. I tried new batteries and still not functioning. You can press on the display and the LCD characters change, but doesn't change to where you can read them. Amazon stays away from intervening. I'm looking at buying the Bosch it use to be a good brand so we'll see after sitting for a while. Buyer beware...
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Handy and Affordable
customer_reviews.text: Seems to be accurate. Difficult to use in some light conditions. The e-commerce pledge: To improve the reliability of online reviews, I will post a review of every item of significance I purchase, and update the review when my opinion changes.
customer_reviews.author: David Lark, Architect

customer_reviews.title: Works as described
customer_reviews.text: Works as described and very convenient. However, I find it to be a little awkward to press the read button and maintain the laser dot on the specific point to be measured. Overtime I developed more control and needed less do overs but still not the easiest skill to develop.
customer_reviews.author: Insp Gadget

customer_reviews.title: Quick meter
customer_reviews.text: The buttons are very informative, so even without User guide, you are able to guess and measure. This is my first Measure, I like it. the only thing I puy 4 stars, it's the power may be, so - Laser spot is not visible at daytime, they suggest to use reflector, but I never tried.
customer_reviews.author: Vahram D

customer_reviews.title: I am a measuring god now.
customer_reviews.text: This thing is awesome. I haven't done many productive things with it, but it gives me serious construction site cred. And I think it will come in very handy when we get to landscaping and I don't want to reel a hundred feet of tape every five minutes. From what I can tell, this is highly accurate. Very fast read. Fairly intuitive controls and slightly less in price than the more recognizable brands. The holster is nice, too. Recommend!
customer_reviews.author: William E. Smith

customer_reviews.title: I've never owned one of these before..
customer_reviews.text: This is great. I've never owned one of these before and i can honestly say this is a must have tool for any home owner. It is extremely accurate and easy to use. Not only that but as listed it can do a wide variety of different tasks and calculations. Great tool to have when you need to measure long distances by yourself.
customer_reviews.author: Cedrick D

customer_reviews.title: Initial impressions, good for non-pro
customer_reviews.text: I've only had a few minute playing with it ... but for the non- professional/contractor, this is likely more than enough. Slightly smaller than the size of two iPhone 5s stacked on top of each, feels like a sold build for infrequent use. I don't think it would hold up using it daily in a construction area, but office/IT staff, this might also work well for. Tip ... the lower left black button w/ the "U" on it ... long, slow press to change units. (depress and hold for about a second - so about 2-3 times longer than the typical key press. )
customer_reviews.author: David P. Discher

customer_reviews.title: Love this little gadget
customer_reviews.text: I don't know why it took me so long to buy one, but this is great. Very simple to use, and turns field measuring into a quick and easy process. I have only had it for a couple weeks and already used it on 3 different projects.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Chudley

customer_reviews.title: It solved my problem
customer_reviews.text: I don't need to buy regular tape measure anymore. After I read the instructions , need to balance XY axis to check the distance . It takes few minutes to read and follow it. But after that , pretty good product . It's easy to check the distance and height .
customer_reviews.author: jingchaowu

customer_reviews.title: Love It
customer_reviews.text: Replaced my old bosch laser measure with this, for me the interface is much simpler and I love that it reads out in inches + fractions, makes work much easier. Haven't done any rigorous testing on the accuracy, but for general layout measuring and planning its excellent, far happier with this than the bosch.
customer_reviews.author: user

customer_reviews.title: Works great. Need to read instructions for more than simple measurement.
customer_reviews.text: This worked great for me when I needed to expand an opening to fit a new refrigerator. My attempt to eyeball it was off, so I'm glad I had this. If you need to use any of the advance features, I think you'll need to read the instructions. It's not difficult to use once you know how it works, but it's not completely obvious, either.
customer_reviews.author: MEL

customer_reviews.title: Very good except included batteries
customer_reviews.text: Works very well don’t use included batteries mine were corroded and leaking in package. Maybe had been on shelf for long time. I got a laser level from same vendor it included their own branded batteries that were fine.
customer_reviews.author: Harry Coover

customer_reviews.title: In bright sunlight near its maximum length it is difficult to see
customer_reviews.text: Works well but when approaching its limit the dot is difficult to see in bright light. Indoors it is great. Outdoors in cloudy conditions or in brighter light of up to approx. 50' it also works well. For the price, I am very happy with this unit.
customer_reviews.author: gbdusmc

customer_reviews.title: Cumbersome
customer_reviews.text: Kinda too technical if your just going to quickly measure say a window for a blind. But if measuring all day is your thing, this may help. I would not buy it again. Cumbersome and I would dare to say overly complicated for a measuring device.
customer_reviews.author: Frederick Smith

customer_reviews.title: Great device
customer_reviews.text: Works as it should, very easy to use, love the different measuring options with imperical and metric. Being in IT we tend to use metric quite a bit. Also the reflective card is a nice thought. The case is surprisingly great quality. The device also feels well-built and very durable as it could easily take a several drops from a standing position.
customer_reviews.author: IT Engineer

customer_reviews.title: Good product, little pricey
customer_reviews.text: It does what it's suppose to do. For the price, I wish it came with a case or something to keep it safe. It's extremely handy to have the marker on it. Make the job easier. Overall, I'm happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: Brandon

customer_reviews.title: Works well (once you figure it out)
customer_reviews.text: The display and functionality aren't intuitive, but the device does what it does well. My only upgrade would be a lock on the base-to-target setting (the default setting that gives a measurement that includes the length of the device). I can see accidentally changing that setting and the ensuing disaster...
customer_reviews.author: Kupius

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use
customer_reviews.text: For the price, this can't be beat. it has all the settings a home project guy will love. Very easy to adjust settings and works perfect for measuring long distances. I did do a lot of comparison with my trusty tape measure and this is completely accurate.
customer_reviews.author: robhein

customer_reviews.title: Great Device and it works well
customer_reviews.text: I love this device. It works very well. I just tried it for 3 days on a new Job and worked exactly as advertised. I highly recommend it. It would be nice if I take a picture on an iPhone and this device sync with teh phone on an App to allow me to write the measurements on the Photo. This will be a life saver.
customer_reviews.author: Nidal Kerdiya

customer_reviews.title: Reliable and Accurate
customer_reviews.text: Out performed a Bosch laser on the job site I've currently been at. Measured a distance above 170ft with both lasees and walked out the distance with a measuring wheel to verify. The tack life was more accurate. For the money, this is a great value. If you take the time to calibrate and read through the manual, this can be your best friend on a job site.
customer_reviews.author: Scott

customer_reviews.title: Best DME unit I have owned for the price!
customer_reviews.text: Unit is a little confusing to operate, but once you get used to it, it's a wonderful device. Accurate right off the shelf. Used it to measure the whole house for flooring estimates. Taking it to Africa for work this summer.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Watt

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: I had a lot of areas to measure and a tape measure just wasn't in the cards. I found this TackLife HD60 and was impressed with how fast and easy the unit was to use. The price is right and t takes the hassle out of trying to use tapes that aren't long enough. I measure each room in my house in less than 30 minutes.
customer_reviews.author: J R Moore

customer_reviews.title: Awesome
customer_reviews.text: I wasn’t so sure at first but has been rated top 10 in 2020 and now that I own it is amazing. I sell floors and hasn’t failed me not even once in about 3 months. I use it everyday
customer_reviews.author: auyanetjl

customer_reviews.title: Great!
customer_reviews.text: I didn't know how handy this would be. But my wife was installing cabinet liners and this is so handy to just point and press a button. I've tested it with a ruler and it's very accurate!
customer_reviews.author: Paul Shuckhart

customer_reviews.title: Great Tool for the DIYer
customer_reviews.text: Awesome product with many functions. Makes measuring rooms a snap. You can even program it to tell you the area. The instruction manual straight sucks so be prepared to figure a lot of things out on your own though.
customer_reviews.author: Tito

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: It worked just fine, wasn't sure if I should buy it bc if the mixed reviews but it works just fine. I haven't used a Bosch before for comparison but this one works like a charm
customer_reviews.author: efx

customer_reviews.title: Great price and works well
customer_reviews.text: Bought this laser measuring tool a few months go and have been using it since. Works very well and is accurate. I wouldn't use it for finish carpentry but it is perfect for measuring out square footage on a house quickly. Battery life is so good I don't even think about it. It is kept in it's little case in my tool box - so it doesn't need any special treatment. I would recommend to anyone - I'm not disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: xrftester

customer_reviews.title: You need one? This is a good one!
customer_reviews.text: Great price, well built and very accurate, it’s also quite a handy size. The modes are easy to manage and it does the job well. I think the trigger is in a bad place, it’s hard to situate the device properly on a wall and trigger the device. Also there should be a master on/off, more than one I have seen the device was accidentally turned on in the case.
customer_reviews.author: SafeRider

customer_reviews.title: I wish I'd bought this years ago
customer_reviews.text: I'm an architect , and I have to measure houses and buildings often. I was always skeptical of these, and was stuck with measuring with a tape ruler which is a huge pain. The accuracy is incredible, it's easy and compact. I couldn't ask for more.
customer_reviews.author: Guitar playr

product_meta.title: Tacklife HD60 Classic Laser Measure 196Ft M/In/Ft Mute Laser Distance Meter with 2 Bubble Levels, Backlit LCD and Pythagorean Mode, Measure Distance, Area and Volume - Carry Pouch and Battery Included
feature_bullets: Ideal Gift for your family & friends to do DIY at home

▲HIGHER ACCURACY - With unique 2 Bubble Levels, providing more precise measurement compared to one bubble; Accuracy:±1/16 inch; Measuring range ups to 196 feet to meet your regular measuring need; Hold the U button 2s to switch unit among M/In/Ft freely

▲BETTER OPERATION - Handy and compact mode provide good operating feeling; Supplied durable carrying pouch keeps the laser meter off dust; It also for easy carry and hold everywhere; Large LCD with back light supports better visibility in low-light conditions

▲VARIOUS SETTINGS - Automatic calculation of area and volume; 30 groups data memory; Manually delete data; 6 units for selection; Calibration; Addition and subtraction; Automatic shutdown without operation 150s; Max&Min values measurement; Assures you a easy and quick measurement to improve working efficiency

▲WIDE APPLICATION - With multiple measurement modes like distance, volume, area measurement, continuous measurement and measurement by Pythagoras, the laser level is ideal for home, construction and industries, especially in large areas such as rooms, apartments, buildings, real estates, factories, warehouses, etc

▲PACKAGE CONTENTS - Tacklife HD60 Laser Measuring Device 196Ft; AAA Batteries; User Manual; Portable Bag; Hand Strap; Package Box; 24 Months Service (Ideal thanksgiving gifts and christmas gifts for family and friends)

specifications.Special Features:
Individual length measurement
4-line LCD Screen with Backlight
Mute Button
Waterproof & Dust-proof Function
Min/Max. value
Continuous measurement
Addition and substration
Indirect Pythagorean theorem
Area, Volume,distance, length Measurement
Auto Power off
Auto laser off
specifications.Included Components:
TACKLIFE HD60 Laser Measuring Device 196Ft
2 AAA Batteries
User Manual
Portable Bag
Hand Strap
Hand-held Reflector
Package Box
24 Months Service
specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.6 out of 5 stars1,811 ratings4.6 out of 5 stars
